items.title: Sources: Carrick set to be new United boss
items.summary: Michael Carrick has growing support within Manchester United for the role of interim manager, with sources telling ESPN that the former midfielder has significant backing.

items.title: Alonso out at Madrid, Arbeloa named new coach
items.summary: Real Madrid on Monday announced that Xabi Alonso would no longer coach the club "by mutual agreement."

items.title: Sources: Gallagher set to join Spurs from Atleti
items.summary: Conor Gallagher is set to join Tottenham Hotspur from Atl√©tico Madrid, sources close to the LaLiga club have told ESPN.

items.title: Barnsley coach: Szoboszlai backheel 'disrespectful'
items.summary: Barnsley head coach Conor Hourihane has criticised Dominik Szoboszlai for being "disrespectful" in Liverpool's 4-1 victory over his side after the midfielder tried to backheel the ball inside his own penalty area.

items.title: A 'weird' and 'incredible' error - but was Szoboszlai disrespectful?
items.summary: Liverpool beat Barnsley 4-1 in FA Cup fourth round but it was Dominik Szoboszlai's first-half error that had lots of people talking.

items.title: Alonso wasn't perfect, but sacking him ignores Madrid's real problems
items.summary: Xabi Alonso's time in charge of Real Madrid is over, but his dismissal will hardly solve the numerous problems the club is combatting.

items.title: Viraal gaande Afrika Cup-fan krijgt een auto van Congolese president
items.summary: De meest besproken fan van deze Afrika Cup-editie is zonder twijfel Michel Kuka Mboladinga. De trouwe supporter van DR Congo ging eerder dit toernooi viraal. Nu is hij door zijn president ook nog beloond met een fraai cadeau: een Jeep.

items.title: Slot over mislukt hakje Szoboszlai: 'Daar heb ik wel een mening over'
items.summary: Arne Slot vond het een gekke beslissing van Dominik Szoboszlai om in zijn eigen zestien een hakbal te geven. De Hongaar gaf daarmee een doelpunt weg voor Liverpool in het gewonnen FA Cup-duel met Barnsley. Verder wilde Slot zijn mening vooral voor zich houden.

items.title: 'Disrespectful' - Barnsley boss unhappy with Szoboszlai for goal mistake
items.summary: Barnsley head coach Conor Hourihane says Dominik Szoboszlai was "disrespectful" to his team after the Liverpool midfielder made a bizarre, freak error which got the League One side a goal.

items.title: Stunt Paris FC maakt het cirkeltje rond
items.summary: In deze VI Live volgen we het gem√™leerde programma in binnen- en buitenland op de voet. De Keuken Kampioen Divisie is terug na de (verlengde) winterstop, verder spelen Liverpool en Paris Saint-Germain in de bekertoernooien.

items.title: PSG uit Franse beker gebonjourd door buurman Paris FC
items.summary: Paris Saint-Germain ligt uit de Franse beker. De regerend Champions League-winnaar ging maandag ten onder tegen buurman Paris FC. Daardoor kent de Coupe de France na twee jaar weer eens een andere winnaar.

items.title: Liverpool power past brave Barnsley in the FA Cup to spare Szoboszlai‚Äôs blushes
items.summary: The scoreline was far more convincing than Liverpool‚Äôs performance against League One opposition. Barnsley made Arne Slot‚Äôs side battle for the right to host Brighton in round four while their head coach, Conor Hourihane, accused Dominik Szoboszlai of disrespect for gifting his team a goal while showboating. Slot appeared inclined to agree. Liverpool were grateful for a late Florian Wirtz-inspired flourish for an ultimately comfortable margin of victory and banishing any anxieties. But this had been another slog against a low defensive block until the expensive substitute swept home a fine third goal and created a stoppage‚Äëtime fourth for Hugo Ekitik√©. There was no more relieved man inside Anfield than Szoboszlai. Continue reading...

items.title: Juventus viert zijn grootste overwinning van het seizoen
items.summary: Juventus heeft maandag een zorgeloze avond beleefd tegen Cremonese. De ploeg van Luciano Spalletti laat met de grootste overwinning van dit seizoen zien dat het nog zeker niet afgeschreven kan worden in de strijd om de Scudetto.

items.title: Australia great Healy to retire after India series
items.summary: Australia captain Alyssa Healy will retire following India's upcoming tour after a trophy-laden 15-year career that has seen her win eight World Cups.

items.title: Tottenham agree ¬£34.6m deal for Conor Gallagher to head off Aston Villa interest
items.summary: Spurs make Atl√©tico Madrid offer worth ¬£25m upfront Former Chelsea man keen on Premier League return Tottenham look to have beaten Aston Villa to the signing of Conor Gallagher from Atl√©tico Madrid after agreeing a transfer fee of up to ‚Ç¨40m (¬£34.6m) for the England midfielder. Talks with Atl√©tico have progressed rapidly and Gallagher is understood to be keen to move back to the Premier League to boost his chances of making England‚Äôs World Cup squad, having made just four starts in La Liga this season. Spurs were in the market for midfield reinforcements after Rodrigo Bentancur sustained a hamstring injury that is likely to keep him sidelined for three months. The club have identified the 25-year-old as their primary target. Continue reading...

items.title: Why Alonso's reign is over at Real Madrid
items.summary: After Xabi Alonso's departure as Real Madrid manager, Spanish football expert Guillem Balague looks into where it all went wrong.

items.title: Skeleton race controversy: Canada defends move amid sabotage claims
items.summary: Canada has launched a robust defence against accusations it deliberately withdrew four athletes from a skeleton race, a move that dashed eventual winner Katie Uhlaender's hopes of qualifying for the Winter Olympics.

items.title: Tottenham agree deal to sign Gallagher
items.summary: Tottenham and Atletico Madrid have agreed a deal for Conor Gallagher worth ¬£34m.

items.title: FA Cup fourth round draw: Macclesfield to host Brentford, Villa face Newcastle
items.summary: Seven Premier League clubs will be visiting lower-league opposition with Chelsea‚Äôs Liam Rosenior returning to his former club Hull City And spare a thought for Palace fans after this weekend ‚Ä¶ Wembley glory in May and despair in January ‚Ä¶ News filtering through that Arne Slot will be taking this game seriously, rather than this time last year when he was run over by Jolly Green Giants. Continue reading...

items.title: Is Carrick the right man for Man Utd?
items.summary: Michael Carrick is favourite to be named Man United's next interim manager. Simon Stone assesses if he is the right fit for the job.
